{{short description|Arena in Bydgoszcz, Poland}} {{Infobox venue | name = Hala Sportowo-Widowiskowa '''''Łuczniczka''''' | image = Bdg halaLuczniczka 27 07-2013.jpg | location = ul. Toruńska 59
85-023 Bydgoszcz | coordinates = {{coord|53|7|10|N|18|1|32|E|type:landmark|display=inline,title}} | opened = {{start date|2002|10|11}} | owner = [[Bydgoszcz]] | operator = "Inter-Bud" | construction_cost = | architect = Zenon Nowacki | tenants = [[Astoria Bydgoszcz]] ([[Dominet Bank Ekstraliga|DBL]])
[[Chemik Bydgoszcz (volleyball)|Transfer Bydgoszcz]] ([[PlusLiga]])
[[Artego Bydgoszcz]] (women's basketball)
[[Pałac Bydgoszcz]] (women's volleyball) |seating_capacity = 8,764 }} '''Immobile Łuczniczka''' is a sport, show and fair [[arena]] in [[Bydgoszcz]], [[Poland]]. In sport it is primarily used for [[volleyball]] and [[basketball]], and also regularly hosts indoor track-and-field meetings. The name was given in memory of the city's hallmark, the [[The Archer (Lepcke)|Archeress]] statue. ==Events== In 2009 ''Łuczniczka'' hosted one of two second round stages of the [[EuroBasket 2009]],[http://miasta.gazeta.pl/wroclaw/1,35751,3851818.html Kibice wywalczyli nam polskie mecze] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090414164024/http://miasta.gazeta.pl/wroclaw/1,35751,3851818.html |date=2009-04-14 }}, 15 January 2007 as well as the Preliminary Round's Group C of the [[2009 Women's European Volleyball Championship]]s. In 2011 (from 18.06.2011 to 26.06.2011) in Bydgoszcz took place Women's European Basketball Championship – the Preliminary Round's Group A and B. Since 2003 ''Łuczniczka'' also hosted several matches of the [[FIVB World League]] (men's volleyball). Recently also the Polish national [[Team handball|handball]] team played its matches in ''Łuczniczka''. The two Bydgoszcz teams competing in the Polish highest volleyball leagues (men's and women's) play its home matches in ''Łuczniczka''. In February 2010, ''Łuczniczka'' hosted the tennis match of the first round of the [[2010 Fed Cup World Group II]] between the national teams of Poland and [[Belgium]]. ==Gallery== File:Bydgoszcz Hala Luczniczka02.jpg|Interior File:Hala Łuczniczka od Jagiellońskiej b.jpg|General view ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat inline|Hala Łuczniczka}} *[http://www.luczniczka.bydgoszcz.pl/ Official site of Łuczniczka] {{DEFAULTSORT:Lucznickzka}} [[Category:Indoor arenas in Poland]] [[Category:Sport in Bydgoszcz]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Bydgoszcz]] [[Category:Sports venues in Kuyavian-Pomeranian Voivodeship]] [[Category:Basketball venues in Poland]] [[Category:Volleyball venues in Poland]] {{poland-sports-venue-stub}}
